title: Workshop for Developing Mathematical Problem-Solving Abilities for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment centered on case-based discussions, combining real-time collaboration and asynchronous activities using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can analyze problem cases occurring in actual math classes and design educational activities by applying a three-step problem-solving strategy (cause analysis–solution design–evaluation).

Learners revise their problem-solving approaches based on peer feedback and implement over 80% of high-cognitive-level educational activities (e.g., creative problem-solving, metacognitive strategies).
Learners can perform leadership roles in collaborative problem-solving processes with peer pre-service teachers using discussion facilitation strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
